ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Process of writing an economics paper, research skills, time management.
I learned the structure of a proper economics senior essay. I learned how to conduct a literary review, divide my thoughts into separate sections, and formulate a research strategy.
Econometrics methods, mendeley reference manager (a life-changing tool).
It entirely depends on your topic and your advisor.
It is thesis. I feel like you pretty much learn what you put in?

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Id say the main strengths of the course are the instructor and TA (which this year were Professor Toseland and Natalia). I think especially early on in the thesis writing process, its expected that you struggle with some aspect of the project  not just small coding bugs, but potentially also more bigger picture structure of your theoretical economic model, empirical model to analyze data, research question, etc. Especially if you are unable to meet with your advisor regularly or have significantly constrained time to ask questions, I found Natalia and Professor Toseland as great resources  especially for questions you think may be too basic to ask your professor, or just want a sounding board to help get you unstuck, this class serves as a wonderful resource. Like many things at Yale, the resource is there, but how much you get out of it depends on how much you use it!

The strength of the course is that Rebecca brings an infectious energy to the senior essay writing workshop that is needed in order to bring excitement to writing a daunting and lengthy essay. She is flexible and constantly asks for feedback. The weakness of the course was that many of the concepts covered were not broadly applicable to all essays. Further, writing groups were more difficult to connect with in practice than in theory. It may have been a good idea to set aside time during the class period to meet and catch up with writing groups.

The methods lectures were interesting but I would have preferred higher in-person attendance. My level of engagement wasn't as high as I would have liked because there were barely any people in class.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes if pursuing economics graduate school, maybe if not, depending on student's interests
Yes, I think the senior essay is a great culmination of the major, and the department makes a strong case for the two-semester essay.

Yes. This is a great way to stay on top of writing a senior thesis and Rebecca is an amazing resource. She makes herself available and interested and makes students excited to research and write their essay.
required for senior essay -- write a 2 term essay!
Yes! The faculty were very helpful.
Yes write a thesis. It is good for you.
